title: Randomly Shuts Down, Sometimes with Quick Battery Drain; NEVER Occurs When Charging
content:
In the last week, my Pixel 3 has been:
Seemingly randomly shutting down, even though the battery is charged (it could be 25%, 50%, 80%, etc.).
Sometimes there is a quick battery drain below 15% where it shuts down within seconds.

However, there is NEVER a problem when it is plugged in and is recharging.

Here's what I've done:
Contacted Google Chat Support.
Initiated a factory reboot (recommended by Support). and backup/restore.
Started in Safe-Mode.
Confirmed I've the most recent updates.
Checked the battery usage for problems.

Problem persists.

Google Support says I can have it sent to them to be repaired for $80 but will take ten to fourteen days (there seems to be no walk-in drop-off in my New York Zip Code of 10003). 

However, this is too long for me not to have a business phone.

Questions:
Have you come across this?
Any other solution?
It seems like a battery issue, right?
Can I replace the battery on my own, to save time?

Thanks in advance.
